subject: Science
title: What Causes Tides?
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Causes Tides? usable.

hook.text: Twice a day, the ocean rises and falls. The Moon is pulling it.

buildup.text: The Moon's gravity tugs on the nearest ocean water, creating a bulge.

discovery.text: A second bulge forms on the opposite side â€” because Earth is pulled away from the water there.

twist.text: The Sun also affects tides. When Sun and Moon align, tides are extra strong.

climax.text: The Bay of Fundy in Canada has tides of 16 meters â€” taller than a four-story building.

punchline.text: The Moon can't touch the ocean, but it lifts it 16 meters twice a day.

quiz.question: Why are there two tidal bulges on opposite sides of Earth?
options: The Moon pulls water on one side, Earth is pulled away on the other
The Sun creates the second bulge
Wind pushes water to the other side
